accreditations.name: GLOBALG.A.P.
accreditations.short_description: Globally recognized standard for Good Agricultural Practices (GAP).
accreditations.details: A consumer-facing standard that certifies safe and sustainable agricultural production. It covers topics like food safety, environmental protection, and worker health, safety, and welfare. It is often a mandatory requirement for supplying major retailers worldwide.
accreditations.notes: The baseline standard for many exporters. Often includes add-ons like GRASP for worker welfare.

accreditations.name: SIZA Ethical
accreditations.short_description: South African social sustainability standard for agriculture.
accreditations.details: The Sustainability Initiative of South Africa (SIZA) Ethical Trade standard is a local, holistic social standard designed to help South African farmers ensure ethical working conditions and comply with national labor legislation. It is recognized by many international buyers.
prerequisites: Compliance with South African labor laws
Implementation of policies on wages, working hours, and non-discrimination
Clear worker communication and grievance procedures
accreditations.notes: SIZA offers a step-by-step improvement approach and has mutual recognition with GLOBALG.A.P. GRASP.

accreditations.name: SIZA Environmental
accreditations.details: The SIZA Environmental standard provides a practical and achievable framework for South African farmers to measure and improve their environmental impact. It focuses on areas like water management, soil health, waste management, and biodiversity.
prerequisites: Integrated Pest Management (IPM) and chemical records
accreditations.notes: Adopting both SIZA Ethical and Environmental provides a comprehensive sustainability profile.

accreditations.name: FSMA (Food Safety Modernization Act) PSR
accreditations.short_description: U.S. federal regulation for the safety of produce grown for human consumption.
accreditations.details: The FSMA Produce Safety Rule is a mandatory U.S. regulation, not a certification. It establishes science-based minimum standards for the safe growing, harvesting, packing, and holding of fruits and vegetables. Compliance is legally required for export to the USA.
prerequisites: Prevention of contamination from animals and equipment
accreditations.notes: Unlike other accreditations, this is a legal requirement enforced by the FDA.

accreditations.name: Albert Heijn Quality Standard
accreditations.short_description: Private quality and sustainability standard for suppliers to Albert Heijn.
accreditations.details: A comprehensive private standard set by the Dutch retailer Albert Heijn for its suppliers. It typically incorporates and often exceeds the requirements of GLOBALG.A.P., with additional strict criteria for quality, food safety, and sustainability (including SIZA).
prerequisites: Compliance with Albert Heijn's specific quality parameters
Adherence to their sustainability policies (e.g., SIZA)
accreditations.notes: Direct suppliers to Albert Heijn must pass their proprietary audit.

accreditations.name: Tesco Nurture
accreditations.short_description: Tesco's own farm management standard for fresh produce suppliers.
accreditations.details: Tesco Nurture is the UK retailer's private standard for its fruit, vegetable, and salad suppliers. It focuses on integrated crop management, minimizing environmental impact, and ensuring high levels of food safety and quality. It is built upon a GLOBALG.A.P. foundation.
prerequisites: Implementation of Tesco's specific pesticide and residue management protocols
Commitment to biodiversity and environmental protection
accreditations.notes: Suppliers must be specifically approved and audited against the Tesco Nurture standard.

accreditations.name: LEAF Marque
accreditations.short_description: Environmental assurance system recognizing more sustainable farming.
accreditations.details: LEAF (Linking Environment And Farming) Marque is an environmental certification that assures food and flowers have been produced by farmers who are committed to improving the environment for wildlife and society. It focuses on Integrated Farm Management (IFM).
accreditations.region: Global (Prominent in the UK and EU)
prerequisites: Implementation of Integrated Farm Management (IFM) principles
Energy efficiency and water conservation measures
accreditations.notes: Often used in conjunction with GLOBALG.A.P. to demonstrate a stronger environmental commitment.
